intro: Peschiera lundii, commonly known as the Swedish sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, clustered flowers. Native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, it thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils. The plant is often found in coastal dunes and other arid environments due to its drought-resistant adaptations. Its medicinal properties have been explored in traditional herbal remedies.
